messages.title: 60 SECOND Q&A
messages.content: Erin Boyle discusses her position on various local issues, motivations for running, and her background.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Erin has helped families receive a Â£1.3m cash boost via the Uniform Grant scheme.
Erin campaigned to improve local bus services, resulting in new investment for the Number 11 evening service.

issues.brexitEurope: Erin plans to 'make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe, keeping our health visitors to give every family and every child the best start in life.'
issues.economy: Claims that Conservatives have lowered Council Tax by two years and supported local businesses with loan schemes.
issues.health: Personal commitment to the NHS, improving service and reducing debt.
issues.socialWelfare: Mentions family-friendly policies in Europe and improving conditions for families and children.

politicalExperience.achievements: Specializes in legal affairs and social justice.

endorsements.endorsement: Message supporting change with the Conservative party mentioning health service, economy, and family-friendly policies.

quotes.text: There are two worlds in this election - one with Labour government making things worse or change with the Conservatives.

images.caption: Images of Erin Boyle engaging with the community, children, and elderly, as well as endorsement by David Cameron.
